p: Finally, we examined the ability of NS1-PR8 to inhibit IFN-β promoter activation in WT MEFs or TRIM25 −/− MEFs. As expected, NS1 inhibited SeV-induced IFN-β promoter activation in WT MEFs ( Figure 5F). TRIM25 −/− MEFs showed a markedly reduced IFN-β promoter activity upon SeV infection as compared to WT MEFs; however there was still detectable IFN-β induction by SeV stimulation. This residual IFN-β induction in TRIM25 −/− MEFs was further suppressed by exogenous NS1 ( Figure 5F), demonstrating that NS1 inhibits the IFN induction in mouse cells by a TRIM25 independent mechanism.
